channel.title: plotting on Clare's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in plotting on Clare's Blog

item.title: UpSetR: Beyond the Venn diagram
item.description: UpSetR is a package for visualising the intersections of many more sets than is feasible with, for example, Venn diagrams. They are particularly useful when there are many sets but the intersections are relatively sparsely populated. In my research, I find these plots extremely powerful for showing large amounts of information in an attractive and intuitive way, with lots of options for exploring the data.

item.title: Combining inset plots with facets using ggplot
item.description: I recently spent some time working out how to include mini inset plots within ggplot facets, and I thought I would share my code in case anyone else wants to achieve a similar thing.

item.title: Brief introduction to ggpairs
item.description: In this blog post I will introduce a fun R plot, ggpairs, that’s useful for exploring distributions and correlations.
